info.name: Bookstore API
info.description: The Bookstore is an API where the user can view, add, edit and delete a list of books and also users. This is provided to keep track of the list of books and authors that we have registered.

request.description:
### HTTP POST /oauth/token

This endpoint is used to obtain an access token by providing client credentials.

Check information (Readme.md) about _client_secret._

#### Response

- **Status:** 200
    
- **Content-Type:** application/json
    
- The response contains the following keys:
    
    - `token_type`: The type of token issued.
        
    - `expires_in`: The duration in seconds for which the access token is valid.
        
    - `access_token`: The access token to be used for accessing protected resources.
        
    - `refresh_token`: A token that can be used to obtain a new access token when the current access token expires.

## Retrieve User Information

This endpoint allows you to retrieve user information.

### Request

- Method: GET
    
- Endpoint: `http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v1/user`
    

### Response

The response will include the following user information:

- `id` (number): The unique identifier for the user.
    
- `name` (string): The name of the user.
    
- `email` (string): The email address of the user.
    
- `email_verified_at` (string): The timestamp when the user's email was verified.
    
- `created_at` (string): The timestamp when the user account was created.
    
- `updated_at` (string): The timestamp when the user account was last updated.

response.name: Authors
Books

request.description:
### Get Book Details

This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific book.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{url_v1}}/books/1`
    

#### Response

The response will contain the details of the book in the following format:

``` json
{
    "data": {
        "id": "",
        "type": "",
        "attributes": {
            "name": "",
            "author": [],
            "description": "",
            "publication_year": "",
            "created_at": "",
            "updated_at": ""
        }
    }
}

 ```

response.name: Book

url.raw: {{url_v1}}/books/1?name=Las maravillas del mundo 2&description=this is a description to update book.&publication_year=2021

query.value: this is a description to update book.

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to update the details of a specific book by sending an HTTP PUT request to the specified URL. The request should include the book ID in the URL path and the updated name, description, and publication year as query parameters.

### Request Body

- No request body is required for this endpoint.
    

### Query Parameters

- `name` (string): The updated name of the book.
    
- `description` (string): The updated description of the book.
    
- `publication_year` (integer): The updated publication year of the book.
    

### Response

Upon a successful update, the endpoint will respond with the updated details of the book in the following format:

``` json
{
    "data": {
        "id": "",
        "type": "",
        "attributes": {
            "name": "",
            "author": [],
            "description": "",
            "publication_year": "",
            "created_at": "",
            "updated_at": ""
        }
    }
}

 ```

The `id`, `type`, `name`, `description`, `publication_year`, `created_at`, and `updated_at` fields will contain the updated information of the book.

response.name: Book

url.raw: {{url_v1}}/books/1?name=Las maravillas del mundo 2&description=this is a description to update book.&publication_year=2021

query.value: this is a description to update book.

request.description:
### Endpoint Description

This endpoint allows the creation of a new book with the provided name, description, and publication year.

### Request Body

- name (string, required): The name of the new book.
    
- description (string, required): The description of the new book.
    
- publication_year (integer, required): The publication year of the new book.
    

### Response Body

The response will be in the form of a JSON schema with the following structure:

``` json
{
  "data": {
    "id": "",
    "type": "",
    "attributtes": {
      "name": "",
      "author": [],
      "description": "",
      "publication_year": "",
      "created_at": "",
      "updated_at": ""
    }
  }
}

 ```

The response will include the ID, type, attributes (name, author, description, publication year, created at, updated at) of the newly created book.

### Delete Book

This endpoint is used to delete a specific book.

#### Request

- Method: DELETE
    
- URL: `{{url_v1}}/books/4`
    

#### Response

The response for this request is a boolean value (`true`), indicating the success of the deletion operation.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

#### Response Body (JSON Schema)

``` json
{
  "type": "boolean"
}

 ```
